Work on delivery project as a member of an experienced consulting team developing and applying advanced analytics & Machine Learning methodologies. Executes a data collection plan from both structured and unstructured sources that helps in data exploration, hypothesis testing and statistical modelling. Design, develop, and implement models, proof-of-concepts and pre-product prototypes that can be used to generate business decisions. Be able to challenge/complement the current methods used. Able to critically evaluate and propose the correct model and suggest improvements. Prepare presentations and reports on findings as well as recommend next steps to ensure successful project completion Seek and develop innovative methods and processes and keep up to date on latest trends, tools and advancements in the area of analytics and data Interacting with the wider European Data Science Guild, the rest of the European Guilds and other Cognizant Business Units globally. Contribution to & participation in the shaping of the Data Science Guild and its activities A university degree in Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or Operations Research area – or the acquisition of such skills through professional experience consultative approach regarding identifying client issues and commitment to delivering high quality solutions Collaborative team player Know-how in different statistical programming languages such as Python, R, SAS Ability to work autonomously Strong written and verbal communication skills in English Flexibility to travel Nice to have ability to converse in the local language

Work closely with our Chief Growth Officer to build our growth models, shape our growth strategy and enable the entire Growth function to work with actionable insights: We are ramping up our organization by increasing our growth teams, whose work spans across marketing and product, led by our Chief Growth Officer Yara Paoli. You will work on, and further develop, our powerful insight infrastructure with a core focus on enabling others to become data-literate and use data to meet our growth ambitions. Growth models, growth loops, growth funnel optimization, as well as habit formation, hacking the key to a great viral coefficient, and forecasting new growth levers’ impact are only a few of the interesting problems ahead. On top of this you will deal with solving the full spectrum of marketing enablement from attribution modelling to incrementality testing, to marketing automation and next-best action scenarios within a lifecycle analysis context. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in the Data and Growth Science discipline: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better. This role in particular will also set the standard for how to enable data insights for best-in-class growth methodology.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organize analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Have a passion for understanding causes behind the exponential growth of certain tech start-ups, for growth strategies and are familiar with the reasons that led to the rise and fall of growth hacking. 
Understand marketing and the complexities of channel discovery, optimization and experimentation at scale. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for marketing and/or growth cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

We not only look for hard skills when recruiting to Oda, we also search for a fit in mindset and culture. A strong analytical mindset is important in this role, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. We want all employees to have empathy for customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs and desires. You are pragmatic when needed, and enjoy a dynamic everyday life where priorities and needs change. You are also a lifelong learner — we are big on sharing knowledge.

Sterk analysefaglig kompetanse, på tvers av maskinlæring, statistisk modellering og relaterte teknikker
 Sterk dataforståelse, med evne til å forstå og modellere dataenes livssyklus fra kilde, via dataintegrasjon og kontekstualisering mot masterdata, gjennom analytiske modeller (feildeteksjon, feilprediksjon, avviksdeteksjon) og ut i de operasjonelle anvendelsene
 Sterk teknisk kompetanse, inkludert forståelse for hvordan analytiske modeller opererer effektivt på store data i et produksjonsmiljø, herunder også god kunnskap om ulike database- og datalagringsteknologier (SQL, data lakes m.m.)
 God kjennskap til Python (som vårt primære programmeringsspråk på data science-fronten), og spesifikt data- og analysearbeid i Python 
God forståelse i samspillet mellom backend, data science og domenespesialist, herunder hva som bør programmeres i C# og hva som bør programmeres i python og viktigheten av gode brukerhistorier.

The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner.  Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company.

Working with cross-functional teams to standardize, automate and expand Bio-Me’s data science capabilities Develop routine data analysis pipelines and workflows Extracting value from microbiome and medical data with statistical methods Exploring data for developing predictive models/indexes Supporting operational data entering and retrieving efforts Contributing experience and creativity to our scientific community and endeavors Possibility to be involved in reporting and communicating analysis to customers and stakeholders Proficient in the Python data science ecosystem including: Data wrangling (pandas, numpy) Data analysis (scikit-learn, scipy) Visualization tools (matplotlib, seaborn, plotly, etc.) Experience with relational database SQL (MySQL or MariaDB) Familiar with Python testing frameworks (unit tests and feature tests) Experience with Git for version control Familiar with bioinformatics packages (Scikit-Bio, Biopython, etc.) Experience using AWS or Azure cloud Experience dealing with medical data Expert in using Unix Experience with AI/ML Experience working with Agile values (Scrum) Equity package New tech gear Flexible working hours Pension plan Central office near public transit Social gatherings Only applications received through the platform will be considered Selected applicants will be invited for a 15-min call Selected applicants will be invited for an on-site interview with coding tasks Applicants will receive final hiring decision

Build, scale, and maintain data products based on machine learning, optimization, and other types of algorithms on Google Cloud Platform. We run all of this in containers on Kubernetes under the hood, but as a data scientist, you should only need to know how to write Python code to get your stuff into production! 
Develop and deploy your own data pipelines with feature engineering, model training, and whatever else you need to get the job done. We use Argo Workflows to run all of our Python pipelines in containers, and dbt to run everything SQL on our Snowflake data warehouse. 
Work with product managers, data analysts, business representatives, and other stakeholders to understand their problems and design clever algorithmic solutions, and make sure we properly define success for improvements, establish baselines, and measure effects. 
Perform complex data analysis, communicate insights tailored to different audiences, and make recommendations based on your findings that contribute to company strategic decisions. We strive to preach and practice decision intelligence in organizational decision-making, and as a member of Data & Insight, you play a key role in these efforts. 
Contribute to our data- and insights-driven culture and community by sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team and with the company. We even have our own Data University, which is Data & Insight’s knowledge base and course catalog on everything from making correct decisions based on data to building better data products. 
Have some years of experience working as a data scientist in a business or research setting. 
Feel productive with Python and SQL, and enjoy both building things and extracting insights from data. 
Know how to apply different algorithms to solve different problems — whether it is ARIMA models for forecasting or neural networks for product recommendations — and are excited to expand your comfort zone by learning new methods and diving deeper into particular subfields. 
Have a structured approach to solving both narrowly scoped and open-ended problems, with the ability to both find optimal solutions and make appropriate cost/benefit tradeoffs. 
Are able to communicate and empathize with customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs, and desires. 
Can work independently, manage your own time, and take ownership of tasks from start to finish in a dynamic environment where priorities are subject to change along the way while thriving in teams where everyone contributes their best work. 
Are eager to continuously develop, nurture and share skills through feedback and learning, together with the people around you. 
Fluency in English. 
Have a Master’s degree within a technical/engineering field or quantitative field, like computer science, physics, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc. 
Possess a strong analytical mindset, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, and curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. 
The opportunity to make a lasting mark on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are over 30 of us embedded in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast-growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about supporting and helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment, and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's — a framework we share with Google, Twitter, and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay in the loop with fewer e-mails and meetings. 
A culture that embraces and celebrates differences, built on tolerance, collaboration, and compassion. We actively seek to hire people with differences in education, personality, skillset, life experience, and knowledge base. 
The possibility to take stock in the success of the company.

Work on delivery project as a member of an experienced consulting team developing and applying advanced analytics & Machine Learning methodologies. Executes a data collection plan from both structured and unstructured sources that helps in data exploration, hypothesis testing and statistical modelling. Design, develop, and implement models, proof-of-concepts and pre-product prototypes that can be used to generate business decisions. Be able to challenge/complement the current methods used. Able to critically evaluate and propose the correct model and suggest improvements. Prepare presentations and reports on findings as well as recommend next steps to ensure successful project completion Seek and develop innovative methods and processes and keep up to date on latest trends, tools and advancements in the area of analytics and data Interacting with the wider European Data Science Guild, the rest of the European Guilds and other Cognizant Business Units globally. Contribution to & participation in the shaping of the Data Science Guild and its activities A university degree in Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or Operations Research area – or the acquisition of such skills through professional experience consultative approach regarding identifying client issues and commitment to delivering high quality solutions Collaborative team player Know-how in different statistical programming languages such as Python, R, SAS Ability to work autonomously Strong written and verbal communication skills in English Flexibility to travel Nice to have ability to converse in the local language

Two to five years of solid experience working with Machine Learning and AI 
You are comfortable with scripting/programming languages such as Python, R or Scala 
You use open-source products such as Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Apache Airflow 
Have experience with cloud platforms (GCP), including Docker instances and Kubernetes 
Good knowledge of SQL and working experience with BI tools so that you can perform "simple to complex" analytics 
You ideally have a degree from higher education that provides a rigorous scientific foundation for your work within the AI world. In case you do not possess a strong educational background, you may have exceptionally recognizable qualities. For example: You are one of the top rankers in Kaggle or similar data science competition venues. Or you are from startup background, where the idea of your data product was patented or patentable. 
You know the difference between MVP, Pre-production, and Production-level analytics. Your definition of DONE means to deliver production-ready analytics and AI products. 
You love to work in data product teams, enjoy two-way learning from peers, and you have a thirst for continually developing yourself professionally 
You are super skilled in business communication; you use high-level BI tools to communicate insights with operational decision makers, such as product managers, product owners, marketing & sales operational managers, digital and physical customers' touch-point managers, and the business owners. 
Curious and have a passion for technology in general and like to stay updated on tech trends 
You like to acquire new knowledge and share your knowledge 
You understand the business perspective and like to be a part of delivering genuine business value 
You are result-oriented, problem solver and flexible 
Positive, respectful, inclusive and embrace collective success 
Look at your colleagues as valuable and treat them with respect 
Get motivation and inspiration by working in teams 
Help other remove impediments and make their day great 
Are concerned about developing sustainable solutions 
Can relate to our values; Business minded, Passion, Friendship, Happiness, Make it easy, Responsible 
Competitive salary and benefits package 
Flexible work hours 
Modern offices with high standards located at Slependen, Oslo 
Amazing lunch and coffee shop 
Great work environment and social activities on a regular basis Viken

company_offeredRole: Accenture – Applied Intelligence - Full Stack Data Scientist
listing_jobDesc:
Relevant work experience in data science, machine learning, and business analytics 
Practical experience in coding languages eg. Python, R, Scala, etc.; (Python preferred) 
Strong proficiency in database technologies eg. SQL, ETL, No-SQL, DW, and Big Data technologies eg. pySpark, Hive, etc. 
Deep Understanding or Experience in Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Kubernetes 
Experience of of machine learning modelling techniques and how to fine-tune those models eg. XGBoost, Deep Neural Networks, Transformers, Markov chains, etc. 
Experience using specialized machine learning libraries eg. Fastai, Keras, Tensorflow, pytorch, sci-kit learn, huggingface, etc… 
Must demonstrate the capacity of reading, understanding and implementing new techniques in the field of machine learning as they emerge. 
Experience of using Cloud technologies eg. AWS, GCP or Azure; 
Understanding of Java, C++ or similar 
Understanding of scripting languages such as Python, Perl, PHP, and/or shell scripts 
Minimum of 2 years professional experience in coding, designing, developing and analyzing data and ML models 
Experience with one or more MLOPs tools: ModelDB, MLflow, Kubeflow, Pachyderm, DVC etc 
Understanding of model training, retraining and retraining principles and related data / infrastructure requirements; monitoring model drift 
Visualisation techniques eg. D3.js, ggplot etc.; 
Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills; 
Are able to articulate, communicate and translate a business problem into machine learning solution 
Commercial experience developing Machine Learning models 
Have a broad understanding of Cloud infrastructure services including data processing, machine learning, container services, IAM, VMs, Storage, Networking, Security 
Have experience of data exploration, data preparations or data engineering 
Experienced working on full life-cycle projects 
Capable of working in either an agile or Waterfall development environment, both as part of a team and individually 
Enjoy working in a dynamic, fast paced environment, collaborating with others, contributing to design and estimating discussions and utilising strong stakeholder management skills 
Have worked in a client facing environment 
Hold industry relevant certifications – Associate level and above (experience will be considered) 
Have managed teams and/or worked across multiple projects 
Able to discuss a technical design with stakeholders with different degrees of technical knowledge and different interests in the solution. 
Experienced supporting a development team in applying good development practices such as Continuous Integration and Continuous Testing 
Experienced supporting a development team in ensuring code quality, security, performance, resilience, recoverability and operability 
Understand key software and integration design patterns. 
Experienced understanding business needs, working with technical architects to understand the patterns for different platforms and technical components within a solution and then defining the technical design for a business feature and supporting the development team in implementing it.

Work closely with our Chief Growth Officer to build our growth models, shape our growth strategy and enable the entire Growth function to work with actionable insights: We are ramping up our organization by increasing our growth teams, whose work spans across marketing and product, led by our Chief Growth Officer Yara Paoli. You will work on, and further develop, our powerful insight infrastructure with a core focus on enabling others to become data-literate and use data to meet our growth ambitions. Growth models, growth loops, growth funnel optimization, as well as habit formation, hacking the key to a great viral coefficient, and forecasting new growth levers’ impact are only a few of the interesting problems ahead. On top of this you will deal with solving the full spectrum of marketing enablement from attribution modelling to incrementality testing, to marketing automation and next-best action scenarios within a lifecycle analysis context. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in the Data and Growth Science discipline: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better. This role in particular will also set the standard for how to enable data insights for best-in-class growth methodology.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organize analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Have a passion for understanding causes behind the exponential growth of certain tech start-ups, for growth strategies and are familiar with the reasons that led to the rise and fall of growth hacking. 
Understand marketing and the complexities of channel discovery, optimization and experimentation at scale. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for marketing and/or growth cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

Data Scientist role experience covering implementing and building large data pipelines. Strong problem solving skills. Curiosity and practical orientation. Build, scale, and maintain data products based on machine learning, optimization, and other types of algorithms on Google Cloud Platform. We run all of this in containers on Kubernetes under the hood, but as a data scientist, you should only need to know how to write Python code to get your stuff into production! 
Develop and deploy your own data pipelines with feature engineering, model training, and whatever else you need to get the job done. We use Argo Workflows to run all of our Python pipelines in containers, and dbt to run everything SQL on our Snowflake data warehouse. 
Work with product managers, data analysts, business representatives, and other stakeholders to understand their problems and design clever algorithmic solutions, and make sure we properly define success for improvements, establish baselines, and measure effects. 
Perform complex data analysis, communicate insights tailored to different audiences, and make recommendations based on your findings that contribute to company strategic decisions. We strive to preach and practice decision intelligence in organizational decision-making, and as a member of Data & Insight, you play a key role in these efforts. 
Contribute to our data- and insights-driven culture and community by sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team and with the company. We even have our own Data University, which is Data & Insight’s knowledge base and course catalog on everything from making correct decisions based on data to building better data products. 
Have some years of experience working as a data scientist in a business or research setting. 
Feel productive with Python and SQL, and enjoy both building things and extracting insights from data. 
Know how to apply different algorithms to solve different problems — whether it is ARIMA models for forecasting or neural networks for product recommendations — and are excited to expand your comfort zone by learning new methods and diving deeper into particular subfields. 
Have a structured approach to solving both narrowly scoped and open-ended problems, with the ability to both find optimal solutions and make appropriate cost/benefit tradeoffs. 
Are able to communicate and empathize with customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs, and desires. 
Can work independently, manage your own time, and take ownership of tasks from start to finish in a dynamic environment where priorities are subject to change along the way while thriving in teams where everyone contributes their best work. 
Are eager to continuously develop, nurture and share skills through feedback and learning, together with the people around you. 
Fluency in English. 
Have a Master’s degree within a technical/engineering field or quantitative field, like computer science, physics, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc. 
Possess a strong analytical mindset, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, and curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. 
The opportunity to make a lasting mark on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are over 30 of us embedded in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast-growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about supporting and helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment, and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's — a framework we share with Google, Twitter, and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay in the loop with fewer e-mails and meetings. 
A culture that embraces and celebrates differences, built on tolerance, collaboration, and compassion. We actively seek to hire people with differences in education, personality, skillset, life experience, and knowledge base. 
The possibility to take stock in the success of the company.

company_offeredRole: Director of Data & Insight - Logistics Platform
listing_jobDesc:
purchasing, procurement and inventory fulfillment of orders, including picking and dispatch end to end distribution including delivery offering, route planning and on-road transportation management and driver tools
 
Provide senior leadership and contribute to strategy: Lead the Data & Insight discipline in the Logistics Platform area and be one of the key people in the overall management of the Data & Insight discipline. You are also responsible for the Data & Insight strategy for this area, by ensuring strong value creation from data in the strategy, execution and impact of the teams in the Logistics platform for both data science applications and insights.
 Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in Data & Insight: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organise analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you.

company_offeredRole: Senior / Principal Research Scientist within Smart Cities
listing_jobDesc:
Will you join us working in the research area Smart Cities? We are growing fast and looking for Senior to Principal Research Scientists with a curious and collaborative attitude who are energized to conduct research for a better future within our highlighted research fields:
Digital ecosystems for smart cities (smart environments, intelligent systems, distributed systems, data management)
Data-sharing in smart cities (data markets, data governance, privacy and security preserving technologies, data engineering, distributed ledger technologies, big data technologies, ontologies/taxonomies)
Data-driven citizen centred service innovation in smart cities (public services, mobility, sharing economy)
Resilient cities (Cyber security, situation awareness, emergency preparedness, intelligent city infrastructure)
Sustainable smart cities (energy informatics, digitalised water production and distribution, citizen behaviour change, climate change mitigation and adaptation)
As part of the smart city research area, IFE has joined the My Digital City program (https://mydigitalcity.no) together with Smart Innovation Norway, Østfold University College and Halden municipality. The program aims to drive interdisciplinary research-driven innovation on smart cities.
Position information:
As a Senior to Principal Research Scientist, you will have a well-paid permanent position where 100% of your time is dedicated to research activity (no teaching unless you wish to have a connection to a university, as well). You will spend your time working with private and public parties to carry out applied research work, generating scientific publications, and seeking new research opportunities and funding. You will be surrounded by distinguished colleagues with multidisciplinary research backgrounds in an inclusive workplace with strong national and international networks in research and industry.
Our requirements:
You should have:
PhD and research focus in one or more of our research fields. Given our multidisciplinary focus, expertise in more than one of the fields would be advantageous
A strong publication record in the last 5-10 years in these research fields
Track record of successful grant proposal writing
Track record of leading research projects through to success
A strong international network
You should be fluent in English
You should be interested in creating research groups around your research interests and mentoring junior researchers
Required expertise:
Artificial intelligence; Data science; Cyber security; Virtual reality, Augmented reality, and spatial computing; Robotics and cyber-physical systems; Interaction with complex data and advanced modelling; Modelling and simulation of physical systems; Digital twins;
Human-centred digitalisation; Human-centered artificial intelligence; Humans and automation collaboration; Interaction design; Risk safety management; Human reliability; Organisational psychology; Cognitive psychology
We offer:
A permanent position fully dedicated to research activity
Research tasks in fields that have great potential for large societal impact
Considerable freedom to develop research projects in the direction of your interests
A large degree of autonomy and flexible working hours
Multidisciplinary work environment
Access to state-of-the-art laboratories
A well-established and wide ranging national and international network within research and industry
Growing and healthy organisation that is focused on individual and group development
A very competitive salary with a good pension plan
How to Apply?
The following application materials must be submitted through the IFE job application portal:
Cover Letter
Curriculum Vitae
Location: Halden in Norway. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kd769TCkHRA
Questions regarding the position: You can email questions to our research director Dr. Tomas Eric Nordlander tomas.nordlander@ife.no, department head Stine Strand stine.strand@ife.no or Human Resources Ms. Lise Martinsen Lise.Martinsen@ife.no
We place great emphasis on your personal suitability for the position. IFE is subject to the National Security Act, and the candidate must be able to pass a background check and must be able to obtain security clearance and authorization.
Contacts

Work closely with our Chief Growth Officer to build our growth models, shape our growth strategy and enable the entire Growth function to work with actionable insights: We are ramping up our organization by increasing our growth teams, whose work spans across marketing and product, led by our Chief Growth Officer Yara Paoli. You will work on, and further develop, our powerful insight infrastructure with a core focus on enabling others to become data-literate and use data to meet our growth ambitions. Growth models, growth loops, growth funnel optimization, as well as habit formation, hacking the key to a great viral coefficient, and forecasting new growth levers’ impact are only a few of the interesting problems ahead. On top of this you will deal with solving the full spectrum of marketing enablement from attribution modelling to incrementality testing, to marketing automation and next-best action scenarios within a lifecycle analysis context. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in the Data and Growth Science discipline: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better. This role in particular will also set the standard for how to enable data insights for best-in-class growth methodology.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organize analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Have a passion for understanding causes behind the exponential growth of certain tech start-ups, for growth strategies and are familiar with the reasons that led to the rise and fall of growth hacking. 
Understand marketing and the complexities of channel discovery, optimization and experimentation at scale. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for marketing and/or growth cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

The CCDC is looking for Junior Test Analyst to join our vibrant Software Engineering team. You will combine your technical savvy and attention to detail to help us build higher quality software more effectively.


Using modern technologies, you will collaborate with world-leading scientists and passionate software engineers to address gaps in the quality to which the organisation aspires. You'll join a creative team developing solutions for new and existing software platforms. 
You’ll solve complex engineering problems. 
You’ll support systems requirements decomposition. 
You’ll implement robust and reusable designs. 
You’ll troubleshoot system software issues. 
You’ll analyse, monitor and improve efficiency and stability of systems. 
You’ll interface with hardware design and development. 
You’ll review code and feedback best-practice improvements. 
You’ll refactor legacy code and develop new ‘clean’ code. 
You’ll actively contribute to sharing knowledge and developing others. 
You’ll produce detailed documentation to comply with company processes and industry standards. 
You’ll plan and estimate development tasks and report status to team leads, engineering and project management.

Knowledge of standards such as RTCA 178C and coding standards such as MISRA C/C++ 
Experience developing solutions for ARM/Intel based multi-core processing platforms 
Communication protocols (I2C; SPI; USB; GPIOs; RS232/RS485; TCP/IP, PCIe) 
Understanding of the Internet of Things (IoT) 
Experience of Agile development and Atlassian toolset 
Familiarity with configuration management tools, defect tracking and peer review 
Experience developing Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment solutions under custom hardware would be a bonus

 You’re a full stack developer and you know what good software architecture looks like, and why it's important
 You understand how to engineer quality software, and appreciate the benefits of automated tests and peer review
 You enjoy working with people to solve problems, choosing the simplest and most elegant approach then iterating
 You're flexible and adaptable, detail orientated, and get satisfaction from delivering to a high standard
 You recognise the importance of continuous learning and sharing that knowledge with others
 High proficiency with at least one backend language (ideally C#/.NET or Python)
 Experience with frontend technologies such as JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and CSS
 Experience using git in a collaborative environment (pull requests, git flow)
 Experience building maintainable codebases using the SOLID principles
 High competency in written and oral English language You've participated in development projects working with agile/lean methodologies
 Experience with microservice based architectures and Docker on Linux
 Experience using cloud technologies e.g. Microsoft Azure
 Experience with SQL and document databases e.g. SQL Server and MongoDB
 Experience of multi-threaded application development

Build brand new functionality from the ground up using the latest web technologies including Tailwind, gRPC-Web and React-Query. Develop customer (and other stakeholder) products and internal tools. Design and develop components and services (both on frontend and backend), and integrate them into the core product. Scope new requirements with the company and our users. Monitor performance and continuously iterate off the back of user feedback. Strong background in JavaScript (TypeScript), React and Node. Experience with Tailwind, Elastic UI and React Query. Experience shipping consumer and business facing applications. Ambition to deliver world class software. You love to learn and continually develop yourself and your wider team. Like to have fun, interact well with others and be a team player. Eligible to work in the UK. A background in design is desirable. Based in a timezone within 3 hours of the UK. Your salary Plus regular salary reviews measured against transparent, clearly defined milestones and market benchmarks. With company performance related bonuses - when we do well, you do well. Not to mention Share Options in our company that grow as you do. We’re a company built around the idea of flexible working. We don’t just sell the dream, we live it. As long as you’re hitting your targets & covering your contracted hours we’re easy about when you work - it’s what works best for you. You’ll get free access to the Desana app to work from wherever’s most convenient or best for you. Anywhere. Or if working from home makes most sense for you, then feel free to work from home. Just know that you’ll have the option to use any of the spaces in our network. You’ll officially get 28 days in your contract. Unofficially, we’re pretty relaxed. If you’re doing a great job and not taking the mickey, who’s counting? Also, take your birthday off, no questions. Meaningful work with people who care. We work with you to set and achieve your professional and personal goals. Friday afternoons are dedicated to personal development - read, meet with mentors, listen to Podcasts, jump on YouTube - but there’s one catch: it has to be relevant to your role & we want to hear what you’ve been learning so we can all benefit and grow too. Personal budgets for books, training courses and conferences for everyone. We offer a 4% employer contribution (we pay you 100% of your salary, then 4% extra into your pension). We use SMART Pensions because they invest in passive Index Funds that are relatively low cost - meaning they should (note the emphasis on should) provide better returns than actively managed funds in the long-term. We’ll automatically enrol you but you can choose to opt-out if you’d like. Casual dress Company events Company pension Employee discount Flexible schedule Work from home Monday to Friday No weekends React: 1 year (preferred) JavaScript: 1 year (preferred) Node.js: 1 year (preferred) Yes

A top-notch programmer with a passion for technology Collaborative and courteous with strong interpersonal and communication skills Eager to ask questions, admit mistakes, and learn new things Fluent in English

Working at Critical Software is more than just a job: here, you can really make a difference.

We’re on a mission to make the world a better and safer place, just like real superheroes. We build rock-solid software for leading industries’ most critical applications, so every line of code we write and every idea we think of can affect the lives of millions.

Now, we are looking for exceptional Junior Software Engineers to embrace this mission.

Are you finishing your academic degree? Or do you have less than two years’ worth of professional experience in software development? Then it's time to join our team of superheroes and start your professional career at Critical Software!


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

To become part of a software development team in a real-life challenging project

To participate in all project development cycle phases, with a primary focus on the implementation phase

To participate in training sessions in order to build strong technical skills


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

The CCDC is looking for Junior Test Analyst to join our vibrant Software Engineering team. You will combine your technical savvy and attention to detail to help us build higher quality software more effectively.


Using modern technologies, you will collaborate with world-leading scientists and passionate software engineers to address gaps in the quality to which the organisation aspires. We will help you develop your career in the direction you dream of, with pro-active mentoring and training. No two days will be the same as you work on a variety of projects (greenfield and maintenance; combining legacy tools and cutting-edge technologies; both desktop applications and WebApps) covering the full software development lifecycle.


You will work within our Scrum teams to help engage and empower developers in the ways of test and test automation with the pride that you’re helping make their work more robust, better validated, and more valuable to the user community!


Please take a look at the CCDC website Home - https://www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/ to see how this is an opportunity for you to contribute to the advancement of global structural science.

We’re on a mission to make the world a better and safer place, just like real superheroes. We build rock-solid software for leading industries’ most critical applications, so every line of code we write and every idea we think of can affect the lives of millions.

Now, we are looking for exceptional Junior Software Engineers to embrace this mission.

Are you finishing your academic degree? Or do you have less than two years’ worth of professional experience in software development? Then it's time to join our team of superheroes and start your professional career at Critical Software!

company_offeredRole: Software Engineer, Ruby on Rails, Remote (UK)
listing_jobDesc:
This is a permanent role with a salary between £50K - £60K. 
Our team is fully remote and so you can work exclusively from home, although we need you to be based in the UK. We will eventually open an office hub in London for meet-ups and team events. 
We work 40 hours per week on average. We don’t work evenings or weekends, although we plan to have a paid-on-call rota. 
Our product and technology team is currently nine people, although we plan to grow later this summer. 
The Room also includes sales, marketing, customer success and finance/data teams. We are currently 30 people. 
You would report to our CTO (me) or another engineering manager when we hire them. I report to our two founders, Alex and Tanya. 
I started my career as a software engineer and have been a CTO for 13+ years, growing teams from 0-50 in startups and small and large businesses. My last job was CTO of Gumtree. This is not my first rodeo! 
You’re welcome no matter what your age, gender, sexuality, race or physical ability. We believe your experience is valuable and should have a voice. 
It’s essential that you have at least two years of recent work experience using Ruby on Rails. We’re building our backend API using Rails so you need to know the framework inside-out. 
You should be comfortable with relational databases and SQL. Our choice is PostgreSQL. 
We write tests using RSpec with a CI/CD pipeline for engineers to deploy frequently to production every day. 
We’re happy Heroku customers and enjoy its excellent CI and Review Apps that are built from GitHub PRs. 
Background jobs are performed using Sidekiq and Redis. 
We are evaluating RabbitMQ to help manage queues. 
We work in cross-functional teams using Scrum, with stand-ups, sprint planning and retrospectives. 
We'll give you a M1 MacBook Pro or high spec PC laptop if you prefer. 
You’ll communicate using Google Workspace (G Suite) and Slack. 
There is a short, initial phone call with our recruiter, Simeon. 
The next stage is a one-hour video call with our CTO (me). I’ll dig deeper into your experience, technical skills and approach. 
Finally, there is a one-hour screen-share/video call for a technical assessment with our lead engineer. We’ll send you a brief beforehand so you can prepare. We’ll ask you to work on a feature and talk about your opinions as you’re coding. 
That’s it. We don’t believe in take-home tests. We don’t use whiteboard evaluations. We try to keep the process as quick and painless as possible.

company_offeredRole: Software Engineer, Ruby on Rails, Remote (UK)
listing_jobDesc:
This is a permanent role with a salary between £50K - £60K. 
Our team is fully remote and so you can work exclusively from home, although we need you to be based in the UK. We will eventually open an office hub in London for meet-ups and team events. 
We work 40 hours per week on average. We don’t work evenings or weekends, although we plan to have a paid-on-call rota. 
Our product and technology team is currently nine people, although we plan to grow later this summer. 
The Room also includes sales, marketing, customer success and finance/data teams. We are currently 30 people. 
You would report to our CTO (me) or another engineering manager when we hire them. I report to our two founders, Alex and Tanya. 
I started my career as a software engineer and have been a CTO for 13+ years, growing teams from 0-50 in startups and small and large businesses. My last job was CTO of Gumtree. This is not my first rodeo! 
You’re welcome no matter what your age, gender, sexuality, race or physical ability. We believe your experience is valuable and should have a voice. 
It’s essential that you have at least two years of recent work experience using Ruby on Rails. We’re building our backend API using Rails so you need to know the framework inside-out. 
You should be comfortable with relational databases and SQL. Our choice is PostgreSQL. 
We write tests using RSpec with a CI/CD pipeline for engineers to deploy frequently to production every day. 
We’re happy Heroku customers and enjoy its excellent CI and Review Apps that are built from GitHub PRs. 
Background jobs are performed using Sidekiq and Redis. 
We are evaluating RabbitMQ to help manage queues. 
We work in cross-functional teams using Scrum, with stand-ups, sprint planning and retrospectives. 
We'll give you a M1 MacBook Pro or high spec PC laptop if you prefer. 
You’ll communicate using Google Workspace (G Suite) and Slack. 
There is a short, initial phone call with our recruiter, Simeon. 
The next stage is a one-hour video call with our CTO (me). I’ll dig deeper into your experience, technical skills and approach. 
Finally, there is a one-hour screen-share/video call for a technical assessment with our lead engineer. We’ll send you a brief beforehand so you can prepare. We’ll ask you to work on a feature and talk about your opinions as you’re coding. 
That’s it. We don’t believe in take-home tests. We don’t use whiteboard evaluations. We try to keep the process as quick and painless as possible.

Work closely with the QA Lead to help improve internal processes and encourage best practices and behaviours. You will have the knowledge of how software is developed in a non-testing capacity. You will be able to develop and set up test automation software and frameworks where necessary. You will have proficiency in multiple programming languages (specific languages are less important than a broad programming knowledge) You will be well versed in the development and testing of complex software systems You will be comfortable working in fast paced teams Base Salary up to £60,000 per year DOE 25 days annual leave, rising to 30 days after 5 years of service Fully remote working option for employees Company Share Scheme Private Family Healthcare Employee Assistance Programme Company contributions to your pension Enhanced maternity/paternity pay The latest tech including a top of the range MacBook Pro Offices in Cheltenham, London and Bristol For those working remotely, financial assistance will be available to help set up your home office There is a well-stocked pantry with food, snacks and drinks when in the office

Not to mention Share Options in our company that grow as you do. We’re a company built around the idea of flexible working. We don’t just sell the dream, we live it. We’ll automatically enrol you but you can choose to opt-out if you’d like. company_offeredRole: Software Engineer APAC - Fresh Graduate Opportunity
listing_jobDesc:
This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

At foodpanda, we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected. We operate in 12 locations worldwide and our cross-functional teams work on large scale, complex systems that reach users on a global scale.
foodpanda is looking for fresh graduates with a passion for software engineering to join our expanding Tech & Product squads! You will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a cross-functional agile team that ships systems to production through a robust Continuous Delivery pipeline, ensuring we build security and safety through automated tests and processes to build quality from the get-go.
Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer with a high level of autonomy and influence. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.

What's on the menu for you:
Gain exposure by working in a cross-functional product team to create solutions and apps focused on our different customers' needs, across global and APAC markets
Write clean, testable, scalable and maintainable code that complies with foodpanda's standards and best practices

What you can bring to the table:
Good knowledge in Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Testing Methodologies (Unit, Integration and Functional)
Passionate about software development, problem-solving and technical challenges
Good communications skills in English, both written and spoken
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or any related technical fields
Prior internships/work experience within related product, e-commerce or technology companies would be advantageous
Highlight any interesting side projects or products that you have worked on and built in the past - this would give us an idea of what you are passionate about
Please attach a cover letter together with your CV stating clearly the timeline of your availability and the tech stacks (e.g. Frontend, Backend, Mobile, Full Stack, etc.) that you would be interested to be considered for

This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

company_offeredRole: Software Engineer APAC - Fresh Graduate Opportunity
listing_jobDesc:
This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

At foodpanda, we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected. We operate in 12 locations worldwide and our cross-functional teams work on large scale, complex systems that reach users on a global scale.
foodpanda is looking for fresh graduates with a passion for software engineering to join our expanding Tech & Product squads! You will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a cross-functional agile team that ships systems to production through a robust Continuous Delivery pipeline, ensuring we build security and safety through automated tests and processes to build quality from the get-go.
Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer with a high level of autonomy and influence. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.

What's on the menu for you:
Gain exposure by working in a cross-functional product team to create solutions and apps focused on our different customers' needs, across global and APAC markets
Write clean, testable, scalable and maintainable code that complies with foodpanda's standards and best practices

What you can bring to the table:
Good knowledge in Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Testing Methodologies (Unit, Integration and Functional)
Passionate about software development, problem-solving and technical challenges
Good communications skills in English, both written and spoken
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or any related technical fields
Prior internships/work experience within related product, e-commerce or technology companies would be advantageous
Highlight any interesting side projects or products that you have worked on and built in the past - this would give us an idea of what you are passionate about
Please attach a cover letter together with your CV stating clearly the timeline of your availability and the tech stacks (e.g. Frontend, Backend, Mobile, Full Stack, etc.) that you would be interested to be considered for

This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

Learning alongside a passionate technology team, who maintain a highly flexible and innovative environment to make Sephora the most beloved beauty community in Southeast Asia. 
Technical proficiency and at least 2 years of experience

It’s in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty. You can unleash your creativity, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can learn and evolve, because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself, because you are what sets us apart. company_offeredRole: Software Engineer APAC - Fresh Graduate Opportunity
listing_jobDesc:
This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

At foodpanda, we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected. We operate in 12 locations worldwide and our cross-functional teams work on large scale, complex systems that reach users on a global scale.
foodpanda is looking for fresh graduates with a passion for software engineering to join our expanding Tech & Product squads! You will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a cross-functional agile team that ships systems to production through a robust Continuous Delivery pipeline, ensuring we build security and safety through automated tests and processes to build quality from the get-go.
Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer with a high level of autonomy and influence. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.

What's on the menu for you:
Gain exposure by working in a cross-functional product team to create solutions and apps focused on our different customers' needs, across global and APAC markets
Write clean, testable, scalable and maintainable code that complies with foodpanda's standards and best practices

What you can bring to the table:
Good knowledge in Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Testing Methodologies (Unit, Integration and Functional)
Passionate about software development, problem-solving and technical challenges
Good communications skills in English, both written and spoken
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or any related technical fields
Prior internships/work experience within related product, e-commerce or technology companies would be advantageous
Highlight any interesting side projects or products that you have worked on and built in the past - this would give us an idea of what you are passionate about
Please attach a cover letter together with your CV stating clearly the timeline of your availability and the tech stacks (e.g. Frontend, Backend, Mobile, Full Stack, etc.) that you would be interested to be considered for

This role is available for an immediate start in 2021.

Job Description
Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, employs about 22,000 individuals globally, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley® and Rockwell Software® product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence, and serves customers in more than 80 countries worldwide.When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people.As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.As a Software Engineer for Rockwell Automation, you will have the opportunity to design and develop industry-leading commercial software, known for its innovation and usability. You will also be responsible for performing basic software testing tasks including, but not limited to, test development, planning, scheduling, and execution. In this position, you will be highly involved in subsystem design, implementation, and testing, working very closely with the support of our senior engineers. You will play an active role in all the stages of the development lifecycle and support your team throughout the process. You will also help ensure that developed products meet requirements and are within total quality management standards. This position will allow you to collaborate with multiple global cross-functional teams. When you join our software engineering group, you become part of a team that believes in knowledge sharing and collaboration and that is committed to using reliable and well-thought-out engineering practices and technology to overcome any challenges. We are looking for someone who will effectively leverage and learn from a diverse set of technical backgrounds and opinions by fostering a team-oriented environment and the use of open and direct communications, honesty and respect. The ideal candidate will also actively seek knowledge of new developments in the software engineering, computer engineering, and test automation fields and will identify and pursue career development and training opportunities. The candidate should be an experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization and an ability to resolve wide range of issues in creative and effective ways. This role reports to the Software Engineering Manager and is located in Colombia What you will do - Independently gathers and documents requirements for a feature and its components, ensuring the information required for the development of software and corresponding test cases are contained in the specifications. - Participates in architectural design and independently develops system designs that meet the requirements. Provides estimates for the design. Considers tradeoffs between requirements, speed, cost and reliability in the choice of a design approach. - Implements and documents code that meets the requirements of the software design. - Leads or participates in reviews of documents, designs, code, test cases and user documentation. - Builds relationships and interacts with peers to ensure assigned tasks are prioritized appropriately. - Thinks outside the box and is willing to research and explore new avenues to overcome obstacles by utilizing the latest technologies and standards. May function as a go-to person for a technology, software methodology, or other area of expertise. - Takes the lead on identifying and recommending software development capability improvements in the areas of software development practices and development tools. Minimal qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent - At least 8 years of experience in a software product development environmentPreferred qualifications - Experience in large, scalable distributed systems and/or SaaS solutions - Software development on Cloud and Mobile platforms - Object orientated design using C++, C#, or Java - Proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, Angular framework, GraphQL - One or more of the following – High availability, performance and scalability, micro services, SOA, modern database architectures, highly automated test systems, rapid prototyping, demonstrable experience of taking concept to product, Web technologies, security, data communication, and contemporary user interface technologies - Software development on both Windows and Linux - Direct experience with design patterns and architecting modular software - Direct experience with the Industrial Automation industry is desired - Direct experience collaborating with local and global technical development teams - Strong interpersonal and English communication (verbal and written)Show more
